topics.learning_outcomes: Use appropriate greetings at different times of the day. Use appropriate language to talk about members of a nuclear family. Give and follow simple commands. Use appropriate language to talk about classroom rules. Use appropriate language to discuss chores and responsibilities of family members. Use appropriate language to tell time of the day, days of the week and months of the year. Use appropriate language to talk about different foods and meals of the day. Use appropriate language to talk about occupations in the community. Use appropriate language to talk about things found at home. Use appropriate language to talk about things found at school. Use appropriate language to describe domestic animals. Use appropriate language for buying and selling. Use appropriate language to talk about community practices. Use appropriate language to deny, confirm, correct and express statements and propositions. Use the plural forms of regular nouns.
Use appropriate language to talk about good manners and behaviour.
Use appropriate language in simple songs.
Use appropriate language to depict real life situations.
Recite simple poems. Recite tongue twisters.
Use appropriate language in describing people and objects.
Use appropriate language to play games.

subtopics: Blend and read words with consonants
Blend and read words with long vowels
Blend and read words with digraphs
Blend and read words with diphthongs
topics.learning_outcomes: Sound out short vowels. Sound out consonants in English. Blend and read words with consonants. Sound out long vowels. Blend and read words with long vowels. Sound out digraphs. Blend and read words with digraphs. Sound out diphthongs. Blend and read words with diphthongs. Read words with consonant blends and clusters.

Demonstrate correct sitting posture. Use appropriate grip to hold pencils. Demonstrate knowledge of basic concepts of print. Draw a variety of patterns. Form upper case and lower case letters in print. Write own name.
Use correct punctuation marks in sentences.
Use knowledge of sounds to build words.
Write dictated words, phrases and sentences.
Re-arrange words within a phrase in logical order. Re-arrange words within a sentence in logical order.
